H0.text: who is the book of acts written to. **Gentile Christians in Rome**

H1.text: who is the book of acts written to. **Early Christian leaders**

H2.text: who is the book of acts written to. **Theologians and scholars**

H3.text: who is the book of acts written to. Jewish audiences

A4.text: the inclusion of Gentiles is reflected in Luke-Acts, which is an attempt to answer a theological problem, namely how the Messiah of the Jews came to have an overwhelmingly non-Jewish church; the answer it provides, and its central theme, is that the message of Christ was sent to the Gentiles because the Jews rejected it
